questions.text:
Steps of intubation sequence are:

a. Flexion of lower cervical spine and extension of Atlanto-occipital joint

b. Inflate cuff of endotracheal tube

c. Introduce a laryngoscope from the right side of mouth

d. Confirm the position of tube
questions.solution:
Correct answer: Option D) a, c, b, d

Explanation:

Steps of intubation:

  • Flexion of the lower cervical spine and extension of the atlanto-occipital joint. It is an optimal and ideal position for intubation (also called the Morning sniffing position).
  • If you are a right-handed person then you will hold the laryngoscope in your left hand and start entering from the right side of patientâ€™s mouth till you see the epiglottis, once the epiglottis is visible, push the epiglottis anteriorly in adults then vocal cords will be visible
  • After this place the endotracheal tube, then inflate it.
  • Cuff pressure should not exceed 25
